Topic.Title: CNBC just said $15 deal coming in for DELL next week

Message.Msg: I will take $15 and run.....have a ton @ high $13's. or Carl's special dividend ;-)) All the shorts on this board are missing the point here - DELL is worth far more sold off in pieces then as a whole; this is why MD is trying to steal the company and Icahn will stop him! Sold off in pieces the company probably is worth over $20 bucks

Message.Msg: 400 million for the banks part, up to $ 390.000 for the boards annual pay, millions for Mr. Dells bonuses, just a fat cow needing someone to run it. A deal of $ 15 dollars cash or keep your stock will get this company.

Message.Title: Mike Dell is a #$%$. And Carl Icahn is putting him and that puppet spec, committee to task.
Message.Msg: He must think he is still living in his dorm at UT. Message.Title: dell/skyera partnership
Message.Msg: my broker told me dell/skyera are competing for a substantial government contract. the other finalist is fusion io. anyone have any knowledge of this?

Dell is just a computer, Microsofts urge to control everything in the software has complicated everything to the point that its not enjoyable,only one of the things that Dell has not come to grips with. A 54 billion company apparently can control things better if they can buy the company at half price.

Topic.Title: CNBC just said $15 deal coming in for DELL next week

Message.Msg: For DELL, not by M. Dell Ichan is going to submit his financing and his bid will be official. The first price to change is likely Blackstone with similar offer for more of the firm.. a less risky proposal. if M Dell bids again, ther is at most one other bidder in the room. He gets only one more shot. Not taking it next week and not at $15.

You can sell them with the stub, but you need to cover, or essentially buy back the shares you need. In that light, this is interesting, because anyone on the sell side of a call who sold to use their capital while the deal clears approval and settle will be in the market for a much smaller pool of public shares when the option is due... if past the deal date.

The owner of the call shouldn't allow the wait though, nomatter the term. they will be exercised before the deal settlement date. I mean, European style calls are different, but really most options should play as i have said.
I fully expect another another 2-3 dollars. M Dell will have a response once there is only one remaining bidder. I think that is why it goes up.
